titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn scrapbooks collection ARC.247
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:49:46 +0000.

physdesc.extent: in two record cartons and ten oversize loose volumes.

did.abstract: The Brooklyn scrapbooks collection consists of nine oversize volumes containing ephemeral materials documenting several subjects in Brooklyn from the 1840s to the 1970s. Subjects include the Henry Ward Beecher adultery trial of 1875, the Brooklyn Theatre fire of 1876, the Coney Island Mardi Gras celebrations of 1913 and 1924, the 1935 proposition of the New York City and Long Island parkway system, World War I and World War II, the Prospect Park centennial in 1966, and several additional topics generally relating to history, business, politics, genealogy, real estate, and social and cultural life in Brooklyn, Long Island, and New York City. Compilers of the scrapbooks include Josephine C. Frost, Spencer Hoag, Helen Cory Mercier, and Herman Nickerson, though the origins of the majority of the scrapbooks are unknown. Materials in the scrapbooks include clippings and obituaries (many from the Brooklyn Daily Eagle newspaper), programs, pamphlets, menus, magazines, invitations and announcements, press releases, theater playbills, poems, postcards, illustrations, cartoons, and photographs. Also included is a scrapbook documenting a 1902 trip to Europe taken by Brooklyn resident Loomis Havemeyer (1886-1971) and his family.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Portions of the collection were the gift of Laura M. Brewster, Don Frica, Josephine C. Frost, George H. Gray, Spencer Hoag, Helen Cory Mercier, and William A. Robbins, dates unknown. Sources and dates of acquisition for remaining scrapbooks in the collection are unknown.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
The collection combines the accessions 1977.128, 1978.081, 1978.129, 1985.067, and 1991.046.
